text: "Hold Me Tight" is a song written and performed by Johnny Nash. It reached No. 1 on the Canadian chart, #5 on both the U.S. pop chart and the UK Singles Chart, #7 on the Cashbox chart, #20 on the adult contemporary chart, and #21 on the U.S. R&B; chart in 1968. It was featured on his 1968 album Hold Me Tight, and the tune was also used in Score commercials. The song was arranged by Arthur Jenkins and produced by Jenkins and Nash. The song ranked #37 on Billboard magazine's Top 100 singles of 1968. The single's B-side, "Cupid", reached No. 6 on the UK Singles Chart, #38 on the adult contemporary chart, and #39 on the U.S. pop chart in 1969. ==Other charting versions== *Johnny Carver released a version of the song as a single in 1969 which reached No. 32 on the U.S. country chart. *Ali Campbell released a version of the song as a single in 2007 which reached No. 140 on the UK Singles Chart. ==References== Category:1968 songs Category:1968 singles Category:1969 singles Category:2007 singles Category:Johnny Nash songs Category:Chet Atkins songs Category:Hank Snow songs Category:Wanda Jackson songs Category:Billie Jo Spears songs Category:Skeeter Davis songs Category:Anne Murray songs Category:Song recordings produced by Richard Gottehrer Category:Song recordings produced by Chips Moman Category:Song recordings produced by Chet Atkins Category:Song recordings produced by Jim Ed Norman Category:RPM Top Singles number-one singles Category:Songs written by Johnny Nash
